cluster_relations.rel_desc: Individual fairytale stories are widely known and loved by global audiences.
The set of tales remains beloved by global audiences.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: endured the test of time; remain
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: AudienceType: readers and listeners of fairy tales

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative work (e.g., story, tale, collection) is widely loved, cherished, or positively received by a particular audience.
args.justification: Both relations describe positive emotional reception of fairytale stories or collections by global audiences, i.e., they are loved/beloved by those audiences. The subject is the narrative work and the object is the audience group, so a single predicate 'is_beloved_by' consistently captures their semantics.

Both relations capture how audiences feel about or value a narrative work (stories/tales being beloved by audiences). This is best modeled as a class of relations about audience appreciation or positive reception of works.

The relations describe an associative/attitudinal link between works and their audiences (who loves/appreciates what), not composition, causality, or spatial/temporal aspects. This fits best under a broad ASSOCIATION-type group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative work (e.g., story, tale, collection) is widely loved, cherished, or positively received by a particular audience.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe positive emotional reception of fairytale stories or collections by global audiences, i.e., they are loved/beloved by those audiences. The subject is the narrative work and the object is the audience group, so a single predicate 'is_beloved_by' consistently captures their semantics.

Both relations capture how audiences feel about or value a narrative work (stories/tales being beloved by audiences). This is best modeled as a class of relations about audience appreciation or positive reception of works.

The relations describe an associative/attitudinal link between works and their audiences (who loves/appreciates what), not composition, causality, or spatial/temporal aspects. This fits best under a broad ASSOCIATION-type group.
